headline: Water Is a Tricky Investment. Here Are Wall Street’s Favorite Stocks.
summary: Water is a constant source of worry amid dwindling aquifers, leaky infrastructure, increased pollution, and rising demand due to population growth, industrial expansion, and agricultural development.  Despite all that, water is surprisingly tricky to invest in.

headline: American Water Works (AWK): Assessing Valuation After Recent Share Gains and Renewed Investor Interest
summary: American Water Works Company (AWK) has quietly outperformed the broad market over the past year, with shares gaining 6%. Investors may be looking for clues about what is driving the moves in this steady utility stock. See our latest analysis for American Water Works Company. After a slow and steady climb, American Water Works Company’s 1-year total shareholder return of 6% reflects renewed interest, as shown by this week’s solid momentum. Although its longer-term performance still lags behind...

headline: Earnings Preview: What To Expect From American Water Works’ Report
summary: American Water Works is set to announce its third-quarter results by the end of this month, and analysts expect mid-single-digit growth in earnings.
